newsitem.title: USA: Bomb scare closes TWA terminal at JFK airport.
newsitem.headline: Bomb scare closes TWA terminal at JFK airport.

text.p: A bomb scare closed Trans World Airlines Inc's international terminal at John F. Kennedy International Airport for over an hour on Saturday after a bomb-sniffing dog thought it had detected explosives in a bag carried by a passenger, officials said.

"The incident happened around 4:30 p.m. EST (2130 GMT) in the TWA terminal at the screening point," said Gwen Williams, a spokeswoman for the Port Authority that operates the three major airports in the New York City area.
She said the terminal was evacuated for more than an hour and an unidentified man was detained by airport police as the New York City Bomb Squad examined the suspicious package.
"It was not a bomb or any type of explosive device," Williams said, adding that it is unclear what was in the carry-on package.

A spokesman for the authority later said that nitrate, a substance used in explosive devices, was found on the man by the bomb squad, but it would not say where. WCBS local radio said the nitrate was found on the man's shoes.
